metadata.name: Potential RipZip Attack on Startup Folder
metadata.comment: Detects a phishing attack which expands a ZIP file containing a malicious shortcut. If the victim expands the ZIP file via the explorer process, then the explorer process expands the malicious ZIP file and drops a malicious shortcut redirected to a backdoor into the Startup folder. Additionally, the file name of the malicious shortcut in Startup folder contains {0AFACED1-E828-11D1-9187-B532F1E9575D} meaning the folder shortcut operation.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\microsoft\\windows\\start menu\\programs\\startup')) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('.lnk.{0afaced1-e828-11d1-9187-b532f1e9575d}')) AND endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\explorer.exe')))
